name: Endorsement
description: A letter of recommendation that you’ll need in order to\nparticipate in the Gym Challenge.

name: Pokémon Box Link
description: A device that allows you to access the Pokémon storage\nsystem. There are some places where it won’t work.

name: Wishing Star
description: A stone found in the Galar region with a mysterious power.\nIt’s said that your dreams come true if you find one.

name: Dynamax Band
description: A Wishing Star has been affixed to it. It lets out a light\nthat allows Pokémon to Dynamax when at a Power Spot.

name: Fishing Rod
description: Use it by the water to fish up various kinds of Pokémon.

name: Rotom Bike
description: This bike can be combined with the Pokémon Rotom to\nuse a turbo boost.

name: Sausages
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. These sausages should be\nboiled before eating.

name: Bob’s Food Tin
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The tinned food that Bob sells\nis curiously popular in Galar.

name: Bach’s Food Tin
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The tinned food that Bach sells\nis curiously popular in Galar.

name: Tin of Beans
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. When simmered, the beans\nsuffuse a dish with their mild flavor.

name: Bread
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. An indispensable tool for\nmopping up that extra curry left on your plate.

name: Pasta
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. These flour noodles make\nfor a surprisingly good match with curry.

name: Mixed Mushrooms
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The chewy texture of the\nmushrooms transforms any dish they’re added to.

name: Smoke-Poke Tail
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. When a Slowpoke’s tail falls off,\nit grows back quickly.

name: Large Leek
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Whether this is the kind of\nvegetable stalk that Farfetch’d like is unknown.

name: Fancy Apple
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. An apple chosen above others.\nIt has spectacular form and a brilliant sheen.

name: Brittle Bones
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The taste boiled off from the\nbones is sure to give a dish a light umami taste.

name: Pack of Potatoes
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Potatoes help mellow out a spicy\ntaste, to make a dish more mild.

name: Pungent Root
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Though carelessly picked, these\nherbs can add a fragrant accent to a dish.

name: Salad Mix
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The assortment of vegetables\nlooks quite appealing and healthy.

name: Fried Food
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. It’s been a while since it was\nfried, so it’s gotten greasy.

name: Boiled Egg
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Even just one boiled egg can\nreally enhance a dish.

name: Camping Gear
description: Everything you need to set up a tent and get cooking in\na Wild Area or at a camping spot.

name: Rusted Sword
description: It is said that a hero used this sword to halt a terrible\ndisaster in ancient times. But it’s grown rusty and worn.

name: Rusted Shield
description: It is said that a hero used this shield to halt a terrible\ndisaster in ancient times. But it’s grown rusty and worn.

name: Fossilized Bird
description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once soared\nthrough the sky. What it looked like is a mystery.

name: Fossilized Fish
description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once lived in the\nsea. What it looked like is a mystery.

name: Fossilized Drake
description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once roamed the\nland. What it looked like is a mystery.

name: Fossilized Dino
description: The fossil of an ancient Pokémon that once lived in the\nsea. What it looked like is a mystery.

name: Strawberry Sweet
description: A strawberry-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it will spin around happily.

name: Love Sweet
description: A heart-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it spins around happily.

name: Berry Sweet
description: A berry-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it spins around happily.

name: Clover Sweet
description: A clover-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it spins around happily.

name: Flower Sweet
description: A flower-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it spins around happily.

name: Star Sweet
description: A star-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it spins around happily.

name: Ribbon Sweet
description: A ribbon-shaped sweet. When a Milcery\nholds this, it spins around happily.

name: Sweet Apple
description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of\nPokémon evolve. It’s exceptionally sweet.

name: Tart Apple
description: A peculiar apple that can make a certain species of\nPokémon evolve. It’s exceptionally tart.

name: Throat Spray
description: Raises Sp. Atk when a Pokémon uses a sound-based\nmove.

name: Eject Pack
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. When the holder’s\nstats are lowered, it will be switched out of battle.

name: Heavy-Duty Boots
description: These boots prevent the effects of traps set on\nthe battlefield.

name: Blunder Policy
description: Raises Speed sharply when a Pokémon misses with a\nmove because of accuracy.

name: Room Service
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. Lowers Speed when\nTrick Room takes effect.

name: Utility Umbrella
description: An item to be held by a Pokémon. This sturdy umbrella\nprotects the holder from the effects of weather.

name: Exp. Candy XS
description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed, it\nwill grant a single Pokémon a very small amount of\nExp. Points.

name: Exp. Candy S
description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed,\nit will grant a single Pokémon a small amount of\nExp. Points.

name: Exp. Candy M
description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed,\nit will grant a single Pokémon a moderate amount of\nExp. Points.

name: Exp. Candy L
description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed,\nit will grant a single Pokémon a large amount of\nExp. Points.

name: Exp. Candy XL
description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed,\nit will grant a single Pokémon a very large amount of\nExp. Points.

name: Dynamax Candy
description: A candy that is packed with energy. When consumed, it\nwill raise the Dynamax Level of a single Pokémon by\none. A higher level means higher HP when Dynamaxed.

name: TR00
description: A frenetic dance to uplift the fighting spirit.\nThis sharply raises the user’s Attack stat.

name: TR01
description: The user drops onto the target with its full body\nweight. This may also leave the target with paralysis.

name: TR02
description: The target is scorched with an intense blast of fire.\nThis may also leave the target with a burn.

name: TR03
description: The target is blasted by a huge volume of water\nlaunched under great pressure.

name: TR04
description: The user attacks everything around it by swamping\nits surroundings with a giant wave.

name: TR05
description: The target is struck with an icy-cold beam of energy.\nThis may also leave the target frozen.

name: TR06
description: A howling blizzard is summoned to strike opposing\nPokémon. This may also leave the opposing\nPokémon frozen.

name: TR07
description: A powerful low kick that makes the target fall over.\nThe heavier the target, the greater the move’s power.

name: TR08
description: A strong electric blast crashes down on the target.\nThis may also leave the target with paralysis.

name: TR09
description: A wicked thunderbolt is dropped on the target to\ninflict damage. This may also leave the target\nwith paralysis.

name: TR10
description: The user sets off an earthquake that strikes every\nPokémon around it.

name: TR11
description: The target is hit by a strong telekinetic force.\nThis may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TR12
description: The user relaxes and lightens its body to move\nfaster. This sharply raises the Speed stat.

name: TR13
description: The user takes a deep breath and focuses so that\ncritical hits land more easily.

name: TR14
description: The user waggles a finger and stimulates its brain\ninto randomly using nearly any move.

name: TR15
description: The target is attacked with an intense blast of\nall-consuming fire. This may also leave the target\nwith a burn.

name: TR16
description: The user charges at the target and may make\nit flinch.

name: TR17
description: The user temporarily empties its mind to forget its\nconcerns. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TR18
description: The user drains the target’s blood. The user’s HP is\nrestored by half the damage taken by the target.

name: TR19
description: The user strikes with a simultaneous three-beam attack.\nThis may also burn, freeze, or paralyze the target.

name: TR20
description: The user creates a substitute for itself using some of\nits HP. The substitute serves as the user’s decoy.

name: TR21
description: An all-out attack that becomes more powerful the\nless HP the user has.

name: TR22
description: Unsanitary sludge is hurled at the target. This may\nalso poison the target.

name: TR23
description: The user lays a trap of spikes at the opposing\nteam’s feet. The trap hurts Pokémon that switch\ninto battle.

name: TR24
description: The user rampages and attacks for two to three\nturns. The user then becomes confused.

name: TR25
description: The user materializes an odd psychic wave to attack\nthe target. This attack does physical damage.

name: TR26
description: The user endures any attack with at least 1 HP.\nIts chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.

name: TR27
description: While it is asleep, the user randomly uses one of the\nmoves it knows.

name: TR28
description: Using its tough and impressive horn, the user rams\ninto the target with no letup.

name: TR29
description: The user switches places with a party Pokémon in\nwaiting and passes along any stat changes.

name: TR30
description: The user compels the target to keep using the move\nit encored for three turns.

name: TR31
description: The target is slammed with a steel-hard tail.\nThis may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

name: TR32
description: The user crunches up the target with sharp fangs.\nThis may also lower the target’s Defense stat.

name: TR33
description: The user hurls a shadowy blob at the target.\nThis may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TR34
description: Two turns after this move is used, a hunk of psychic\nenergy attacks the target.

name: TR35
description: The user attacks in an uproar for three turns.\nDuring that time, no Pokémon can fall asleep.

name: TR36
description: The user attacks by exhaling hot breath on opposing\nPokémon. This may also leave those Pokémon with\na burn.

name: TR37
description: The target is taunted into a rage that allows it to use\nonly attack moves for three turns.

name: TR38
description: The user catches the target off guard and swaps its\nheld item with its own.

name: TR39
description: The user attacks the target with great power.\nHowever, this also lowers the user’s Attack and\nDefense stats.

name: TR40
description: The user employs its psychic power to exchange\nAbilities with the target.

name: TR41
description: The user launches a kick that lands a critical hit\nmore easily. This may also leave the target with\na burn.

name: TR42
description: The user lets loose a horribly echoing shout with\nthe power to inflict damage.

name: TR43
description: The user attacks the target at full power. The attack’s\nrecoil harshly lowers the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: TR44
description: The user absorbs a mystical power from space to\nraise its Defense and Sp. Def stats.

name: TR45
description: The user attacks by shooting muddy water at opposing\nPokémon. This may also lower their accuracy.

name: TR46
description: The user hardens its body’s surface like iron,\nsharply raising its Defense stat.

name: TR47
description: The user slashes the target with huge sharp claws.

name: TR48
description: The user tenses its muscles to bulk up its body,\nraising both its Attack and Defense stats.

name: TR49
description: The user quietly focuses its mind and calms its\nspirit to raise its Sp. Atk and Sp. Def stats.

name: TR50
description: The user handles a sharp leaf like a sword and\nattacks by cutting its target. Critical hits land\nmore easily.

name: TR51
description: The user vigorously performs a mystic, powerful\ndance that raises its Attack and Speed stats.

name: TR52
description: The user tackles the target with a high-speed spin.\nThe slower the user compared to the target, the\ngreater the move’s power.

name: TR53
description: The user fights the target up close without guarding\nitself. This also lowers the user’s Defense and\nSp. Def stats.

name: TR54
description: The user lays a trap of poison spikes at the feet of\nthe opposing team. The spikes will poison opposing\nPokémon that switch into battle.

name: TR55
description: The user cloaks itself in fire and charges the target.\nThis also damages the user quite a lot. This attack\nmay leave the target with a burn.

name: TR56
description: The user lets loose a blast of aura power from deep\nwithin its body at the target. This attack\nnever misses.

name: TR57
description: The target is stabbed with a tentacle, arm, or the like\nsteeped in poison. This may also poison the target.

name: TR58
description: The user releases a horrible aura imbued with dark\nthoughts. This may also make the target flinch.

name: TR59
description: The user slams a barrage of hard-shelled seeds\ndown on the target from above.

name: TR60
description: The user slashes at the target by crossing its\nscythes or claws as if they were a pair of scissors.

name: TR61
description: The user generates a damaging sound wave by\nvibration. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TR62
description: The target is attacked with a shock wave generated\nby the user’s gaping mouth.

name: TR63
description: The user attacks with a ray of light that sparkles as\nif it were made of gemstones.

name: TR64
description: The user heightens its mental focus and unleashes\nits power. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TR65
description: The user draws power from nature and fires it at the\ntarget. This may also lower the target’s Sp. Def stat.

name: TR66
description: The user tucks in its wings and charges from a low\naltitude. This also damages the user quite a lot.

name: TR67
description: The user makes the ground under the target erupt\nwith power. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TR68
description: The user stimulates its brain by thinking bad\nthoughts. This sharply raises the user’s Sp. Atk stat.

name: TR69
description: The user focuses its willpower to its head and\nattacks the target. This may also make the\ntarget flinch.

name: TR70
description: The user gathers all its light energy and releases it\nall at once. This may also lower the target’s\nSp. Def stat.

name: TR71
description: The user whips up a storm of leaves around the\ntarget. The attack’s recoil harshly lowers the user’s\nSp. Atk stat.

name: TR72
description: The user violently whirls its vines, tentacles, or the\nlike to harshly lash the target.

name: TR73
description: The user shoots filthy garbage at the target to\nattack. This may also poison the target.

name: TR74
description: The user slams the target with its steel-hard head.\nThis may also make the target flinch.

name: TR75
description: The user stabs the target from below with\nsharpened stones. Critical hits land more easily.

name: TR76
description: The user lays a trap of levitating stones around the\nopposing team. The trap hurts opposing Pokémon\nthat switch into battle.

name: TR77
description: The user snares the target with grass and trips it.\nThe heavier the target, the greater the\nmove’s power.

name: TR78
description: The user strikes everything around it by swamping\nthe area with a giant sludge wave. This may also\npoison those hit.

name: TR79
description: The user slams into the target with its heavy body.\nThe more the user outweighs the target, the greater\nthe move’s power.

name: TR80
description: The user hurls an electric orb at the target. The\nfaster the user is than the target, the greater the\nmove’s power.

name: TR81
description: The user turns the target’s power against it.\nThe higher the target’s Attack stat, the greater\nthe damage it deals.

name: TR82
description: The user attacks the target with stored power.\nThe more the user’s stats are raised, the greater\nthe move’s power.

name: TR83
description: The user teleports using a strange power and\nswitches places with one of its allies.

name: TR84
description: The user shoots boiling hot water at its target.\nThis may also leave the target with a burn.

name: TR85
description: The user is roused, and its Attack and Sp. Atk\nstats increase.

name: TR86
description: The user shrouds itself in electricity and smashes\ninto its target. This also damages the user a little.

name: TR87
description: The user crashes into its target while rotating its\nbody like a drill. Critical hits land more easily.

name: TR88
description: The user slams its target with its flame-covered\nbody. The more the user outweighs the target, the\ngreater the move’s power.

name: TR89
description: The user attacks by wrapping its opponent in a\nfierce wind that flies up into the sky. This may also\nconfuse the target.

name: TR90
description: The user plays rough with the target and attacks it.\nThis may also lower the target’s Attack stat.

name: TR91
description: Opposing Pokémon are drenched in an odd\npoisonous liquid. This lowers the Attack, Sp. Atk, and\nSpeed stats of a poisoned target.

name: TR92
description: The user damages opposing Pokémon by emitting a\npowerful flash.

name: TR93
description: The user swings both arms and hits the target.\nThe target’s stat changes don’t affect this\nattack’s damage.

name: TR94
description: The user fiercely attacks the target using its\nentire body.

name: TR95
description: The user attacks the target’s throat, and the\nresultant suffering prevents the target from using\nmoves that emit sound for two turns.

name: TR96
description: The user attacks the enemy with a pollen puff that\nexplodes. If the target is an ally, it gives the ally a\npollen puff that restores its HP instead.

name: TR97
description: The user bites the target with its psychic\ncapabilities. This can also destroy Light Screen\nand Reflect.

name: TR98
description: The user slams into the target using a full-force\nblast of water. This may also lower the target’s\nDefense stat.

name: TR99
description: The user attacks by slamming its body into the target.\nThe higher the user’s Defense, the more damage it can\ninflict on the target.

name: TM00
description: The target is slugged by a punch thrown with\nmuscle-packed power.

name: Lonely Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow\nmore easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

name: Adamant Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

name: Naughty Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

name: Brave Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack will grow\nmore easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

name: Bold Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow\nmore easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

name: Impish Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

name: Lax Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

name: Relaxed Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Defense will grow\nmore easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

name: Modest Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow\nmore easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

name: Mild Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow\nmore easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

name: Rash Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

name: Quiet Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Atk will grow\nmore easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

name: Calm Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow\nmore easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

name: Gentle Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow\nmore easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

name: Careful Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

name: Sassy Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Sp. Def will grow\nmore easily, but its Speed will grow more slowly.

name: Timid Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow\nmore easily, but its Attack will grow more slowly.

name: Hasty Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow\nmore easily, but its Defense will grow more slowly.

name: Jolly Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Atk will grow more slowly.

name: Naive Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Speed will grow\nmore easily, but its Sp. Def will grow more slowly.

name: Serious Mint
description: When a Pokémon smells this mint, its Attack, Defense,\nSp. Atk, Sp. Def, and Speed will grow at their usual rates.

name: Wishing Piece
description: Throw one into a Pokémon Den to attract\na wild Dynamax Pokémon.

name: Cracked Pot
description: A peculiar teapot that can make a certain species of\nPokémon evolve. It may be cracked, but tea poured\nfrom it is delicious.

name: Chipped Pot
description: A peculiar teapot that can make a certain species of\nPokémon evolve. It may be chipped, but tea poured\nfrom it is delicious.

name: Hi-tech Earbuds
description: Strange earbuds that allow you to freely control the\nvolume of various sounds.

name: Fruit Bunch
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The syrupy fruits give off a strong\ntropical feel.

name: Moomoo Cheese
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Melted cheese can really give a\ncurry some richness.

name: Spice Mix
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. There are over fifty spices\ncontained within this ingredient’s hot flavor.

name: Fresh Cream
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Add some whipped cream to a\nspicy curry to give it some sweetness.

name: Packaged Curry
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. Using packaged curry helps\nmake sure there are no slipups when cooking.

name: Coconut Milk
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. The refined sweetness of this\ncoconut milk makes it quite popular.

name: Instant Noodles
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. It has a junk-food sort of taste,\nbut it goes well with curry.

name: Precooked Burger
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. If you’re unsure about what to\ncook, you can’t go wrong with some burger.

name: Gigantamix
description: One of the many ingredients that can be used for\ncooking at your camp. A mysterious spice. Even a tiny\nsprinkle is sure to make a curry gigantic.

name: Wishing Chip
description: Toss a number of them into a Pokémon Den for the\nchance to attract a wild Dynamax Pokémon.

name: Rotom Bike
description: This bike can be combined with the Pokémon Rotom to\nnot only do a turbo boost but also run on the water.

name: Catching Charm
description: Holding it is said to increase the chance of getting a\ncritical catch. Curiously, the charm doesn’t shake much.

name: Old Letter
description: A letter entrusted to you by a girl, to be delivered to\na boy. Strangely, it looks old to you.

name: Band Autograph
description: It’s signed by all members of the Galar region’s most\ncharismatic band, the Maximizers.

name: Sonia’s Book
description: Professor Sonia’s published writings. Her new\ndiscoveries about the Galar region’s legends are\nrecorded in this enjoyable read.

name: Rotom Catalog
description: A catalog of devices that Rotom like. Use the catalog\nto have Rotom hop in and out of the various devices\nlisted within.

name: Max Honey
description: Honey that Dynamax Vespiquen produces. Adding this\nhoney to Max Soup makes the taste very smooth. It also\nhas the same effect as a Max Revive.

name: Max Mushrooms
description: Mushrooms that have the power of changing Dynamax\nforms. They boost all stats of a Pokémon during battle.

name: Galarica Twig
description: A twig from a species of tree called Galarica that grows\nin certain areas around the Galar region. It’s a material\nfor an accessory for a certain Pokémon.

name: Galarica Cuff
description: A cuff made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.\nGiving it to Galarian Slowpoke makes the\nPokémon very happy.

name: Style Card
description: A card that increases the selection in boutiques and\nhair salons.

name: Armor Pass
description: A pass to go to the Isle of Armor. Show it to the rail\nstaff at Wedgehurst Station.

name: Rotom Bike
description: This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water\nusing Rotom’s power. It’s a sparkling white that\nshines brilliantly.

name: Rotom Bike
description: This bike can do a turbo boost and run on the water\nusing Rotom’s power. It’s a glistening black that\nshines reddish-black.

name: Exp. Charm
description: A charm that increases the Exp. Points that Pokémon\ncan get. A machine-like object is inside the charm.

name: Armorite Ore
description: Rare ore that can be obtained on the Isle of Armor.\nSomething good will happen if you give it to a collector\non the Isle of Armor.

name: Mark Charm
description: A mysterious and unique charm that increases the\nchance of finding a Pokémon with a mark.

name: Reins of Unity
description: Reins that people presented to the king. They enhance\nCalyrex’s power over bountiful harvests and unite\nCalyrex with its beloved steed.

name: Reins of Unity
description: Reins that people presented to the king. They enable\nthose who are connected to communicate with each\nother. The reins separate Calyrex and its beloved steed.

name: Galarica Wreath
description: A wreath made from woven-together Galarica Twigs.\nPlacing it on the head of a Galarian Slowpoke makes\nthe Pokémon very happy.

name: Legendary Clue 1
description: A clue about the King of Bountiful Harvests. It’s written\nby Peony, and an old photo is attached to it.

name: Legendary Clue 2
description: A clue about the legend of giants. It’s written\nby Peony and has unique drawings.

name: Legendary Clue 3
description: A clue about the legend of bird Pokémon. It’s written\nby Peony and has a unique drawing.

name: Legendary Clue?
description: A mysterious clue that Peony seems to have dropped.\nThere’s a photo attached to it showing a shining hole\nopening above the Max Lair.

name: Crown Pass
description: A pass to go to the Crown Tundra. Show it to the rail\nstaff at Wedgehurst Station.

name: Wooden Crown
description: A mysterious object made of wood. Part of it seems to\nbe chipped. Maybe it’s meant to be part of something.

name: Radiant Petal
description: A single petal that the King of Bountiful Harvests\ngave you. It radiates faint light.

name: White Mane Hair
description: Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful\nHarvests’ beloved steed, Glastrier. The hair is strong\nand very flexible.

name: Black Mane Hair
description: Mane hair that belonged to the King of Bountiful\nHarvests’ beloved steed, Spectrier. The hair is very\nsmooth to the touch.

name: Iceroot Carrot
description: Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved\nsteed likes to eat. It grew in a field covered in snow.

name: Shaderoot Carrot
description: Produce that the King of Bountiful Harvests’ beloved\nsteed likes to eat. It grew in a gloomy field.

name: Dynite Ore
description: Mysterious ore that can be obtained in the Max Lair.\nSomething good will happen if you give it to a\ncollector in the Crown Tundra.

name: Carrot Seeds
description: Seeds to plant in a field. The kind of carrot you’ll get is\ndetermined by which field you plant the seeds in.

name: Ability Patch
description: A patch that allows a Pokémon with a regular Ability\nto have a rare Ability.

name: Reins of Unity
description: Cords that shine when you hold them up to the light.\nThe people of old times presented these to the King of\nBountiful Harvests to express their gratitude.

name: Time Balm
description: A mysterious balm that somehow has the power to calm\nDialga in its frenzy.

name: Space Balm
description: A mysterious balm that somehow has the power to calm\nPalkia in its frenzy.

name: Mysterious Balm
description: A mysterious balm to be used when battling Arceus.

name: Linking Cord
description: A string exuding a mysterious energy that makes you\nfeel a strange sense of connection. It’s loved by\ncertain Pokémon.

name: Hometown Muffin
description: A baked treat made from Berries and other ingredients,\nwhich is often eaten in regions such as Galar. It is\nbeloved by a surprising number of Pokémon.

name: Apricorn
description: A fruit whose shell can be used to form the capsules of\nall manner of Poké Balls when crafting them from\nscratch. Its proper name is actually “Brown Apricorn.”

name: Jubilife Muffin
description: A hidden gem gaining popularity in Jubilife Village and\nbeloved by Pokémon. This sweet treat can be fed to\na Pokémon to cure any status conditions it may have.

name: Aux Powerguard
description: An item that sharply boosts the offensive and defensive\nstats of a Pokémon during a battle. These effects\ndisappear if the Pokémon leaves the battle.

name: Dire Hit
description: An item that sharply boosts the critical-hit ratio of\na Pokémon during a battle. This effect disappears if\nthe Pokémon leaves the battle.

name: Choice Dumpling
description: A dumpling that will make a Pokémon become fixated on\na move in battle. The Pokémon will deal more damage\nwhen using that move but will take more damage as well.

name: Twice-Spiced Radish
description: These pickled vegetables prime a Pokémon for battle.\nThe Pokémon takes a hard-hitting stance, which boosts\nthe power of the Pokémon’s moves by 50 percent.

name: Swap Snack
description: When eaten, this curious snack temporarily swaps a\nPokémon’s offensive stats with its defensive stats.

name: Caster Fern
description: A fern used for crafting items made to be thrown.\nWhen these curled leaves are unfurled, they can serve\nas nature’s wrapping paper.

name: Seed of Mastery
description: A rare seed that can be given to the captain of the\nSecurity Corps to have a Pokémon master a move\nso it can be used in the agile style or strong style.

name: Poké Ball
description: ー\nー\nー

name: Eternal Ice
description: A type of ice beloved by the Lord of the Tundra,\nAvalugg. This ice is said to be fragments of ancient\nAvalugg that lived long ago.

name: Uxie’s Claw
description: Proof that you have completed the trial set by Uxie,\nthe Being of Knowledge that lives in Lake Acuity.\nThis item is needed to forge the Red Chain.

name: Azelf’s Fang
description: Proof that you have completed the trial set by Azelf,\nthe Being of Willpower that lives in Lake Valor.\nThis item is needed to forge the Red Chain.

name: Mesprit’s Plume
description: Proof that you have completed the trial set by Mesprit,\nthe Being of Emotion that lives in Lake Verity.\nThis item is needed to forge the Red Chain.

name: Tumblestone
description: When combined with an Apricorn, this mysterious,\ntumbled stone can draw out the properties required\nto forge a Poké Ball.

name: Celestica Flute
description: A flute that can be used to call special Pokémon that\nare willing to bear you around the region. Its timbre is\neerie and mysterious.

name: Remedy
description: An herbal medicine that can restore 60 HP to a\nPokémon, just as a Potion does. Yet the bitter taste\nwill make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.

name: Fine Remedy
description: An herbal medicine that can restore 100 HP to a\nPokémon, just as a Super Potion does. Yet the bitter taste\nwill make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.

name: Dazzling Honey
description: Honey that sparkles with an amber hue. It is beloved\nby bug Pokémon and Pokémon with fairylike charms,\nso they will gather wherever a comb of it is thrown.

name: Hearty Grains
description: Beautiful stalks of rice bursting with life. Pokémon that\ndwell and wander among the fields love these grains and\nwill gather wherever the stalks are thrown.

name: Plump Beans
description: Large, juicy beans that grow in pods. These beans are\nbeloved by fish Pokémon, as well as bird Pokémon and\ntheir flying ilk, so throw one and they will gather around.

name: Springy Mushroom
description: A large and well-ripened mushroom. It is beloved\nby the more monstrous Pokémon, as well as dragon\nPokémon, so they will gather wherever one is thrown.

name: Crunchy Salt
description: Translucent crystals that are beloved by Pokémon\nbearing a resemblance to grass, plants, or minerals.\nThey will gather wherever a lump of this salt is thrown.

name: Wood
description: A handy log of wood that can be used for anything,\nfrom crafting common goods needed for daily living\nto producing works of art.

name: King’s Leaf
description: The king of herbs, glittering and brilliant. Combining\nthis herb with other materials needed to make\nmedicines will boost their efficacy.

name: Marsh Balm
description: A mysterious balm that gives off a soothing scent.\nIt can be used to help calm the frenzy of the Lady of\nthe Ridge, Lilligant.

name: Poké Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Poké Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn and 1 Tumblestone.

name: Great Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Great Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn, 1 Iron Chunk, and\n1 Tumblestone.

name: Ultra Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Ultra Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn, 2 Iron Chunks, and\n2 Tumblestones.

name: Feather Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Feather Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn and 1 Sky Tumblestone.

name: Pokéshi Doll
description: A recipe for crafting Pokéshi Dolls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 3 logs of Wood.

name: Smoke Bomb
description: A recipe for crafting Smoke Bombs from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Caster Fern leaf and\n1 Sootfoot Root.

name: Scatter Bang
description: A recipe for crafting Scatter Bangs from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Pop Pod and 1 Caster Fern leaf.

name: Sticky Glob
description: A recipe for crafting Sticky Globs from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Spoiled Apricorn, 1 Ball of Mud,\nand 1 Caster Fern leaf.

name: Star Piece
description: A recipe for crafting Star Pieces from scratch.\nRequired materials: 3 Red Shards, 3 Blue Shards,\n3 Green Shards, and 1 bag of Stardust.

name: Mushroom Cake
description: A recipe for crafting Mushroom Cakes from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Springy Mushroom and\n1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Bugwort
description: A wildflower that can be found growing across the Hisui\nregion. It does have medicinal properties, but it is\nso bitter that no wild Pokémon will eat it.

name: Honey Cake
description: A recipe for crafting Honey Cakes from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 comb of Dazzling Honey and\n1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Grain Cake
description: A recipe for crafting Grain Cakes from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 stalk of Hearty Grains and\n1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Bean Cake
description: A recipe for crafting Bean Cakes from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 pod of Plump Beans and\n1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Salt Cake
description: A recipe for crafting Salt Cakes from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 hunk of Crunchy Salt and\n1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Potion
description: A recipe for crafting Potions from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Oran Berry and 1 Medicinal Leek.

name: Super Potion
description: A recipe for crafting Super Potions from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Potion and 1 Pep-Up Plant.

name: Hyper Potion
description: A recipe for crafting Hyper Potions from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Super Potion and 1 Vivichoke.

name: Max Potion
description: A recipe for crafting Max Potions from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Sitrus Berry and 1 bunch of\nKing’s Leaf.

name: Full Restore
description: A recipe for crafting Full Restores from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Max Potion and 1 Full Heal.

name: Remedy
description: A recipe for crafting Remedies from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 Bugwort blooms.

name: Fine Remedy
description: A recipe for crafting Fine Remedies from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Remedy and 1 Pep-Up Plant.

name: Superb Remedy
description: A recipe for crafting Superb Remedies from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Fine Remedy and 1 Vivichoke.

name: Old Gateau
description: A recipe for crafting Old Gateaux from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 pod of Plump Beans, 1 comb of\nDazzling Honey, 1 Sootfoot Root, and 1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Jubilife Muffin
description: A recipe for crafting Jubilife Muffins from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 stalks of Hearty Grains,\n2 Hopo Berries, 1 Razz Berry, and 1 Cake-Lure Base.

name: Full Heal
description: A recipe for crafting Full Heals from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Cheri Berry, 1 Pecha Berry,\n1 Rawst Berry, and 1 Aspear Berry.

name: Revive
description: A recipe for crafting Revives from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Vivichoke and 2 Medicinal Leeks.

name: Max Revive
description: A recipe for crafting Max Revives from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Revive and 2 bunches of\nKing’s Leaf.

name: Max Ether
description: A recipe for crafting Max Ethers from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Leppa Berry and 2 Pep-Up Plants.

name: Max Elixir
description: A recipe for crafting Max Elixirs from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Max Ether and 2 bunches of\nKing’s Leaf.

name: Stealth Spray
description: A recipe for crafting Stealth Sprays from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Hopo Berry and\n3 Bugwort blooms.

name: Aux Power
description: A recipe for crafting Aux Powers from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 bunches of Swordcap and\n1 Pep-Up Plant.

name: Aux Guard
description: A recipe for crafting Aux Guards from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 scraps of Iron Barktongue and\n1 Pep-Up Plant.

name: Dire Hit
description: A recipe for crafting Dire Hits from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 Direshrooms and 1 Candy Truffle.

name: Aux Evasion
description: A recipe for crafting Aux Evasions from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 bunches of Doppel Bonnets and\n1 Candy Truffle.

name: Aux Powerguard
description: A recipe for crafting Aux Powerguards from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Aux Power, 1 Aux Guard, and\n1 bunch of King’s Leaf.

name: Forest Balm
description: A mysterious balm that gives off a soothing scent.\nIt can be used to help calm the frenzy of the Lord of\nthe Woods, Kleavor.

name: Iron Chunk
description: A naturally occurring hunk of iron. Such ore is needed\nto make the requisite parts of numerous Poké Ball\nvarieties, such as the clasp that holds the ball shut.

name: Black Tumblestone
description: When combined with an Apricorn, this mysterious\nblack stone can draw out the properties required\nto forge a Heavy Ball.

name: Sky Tumblestone
description: When combined with an Apricorn, this mysterious\nsky-blue stone can draw out the properties required\nto forge a Feather Ball.

name: Ball of Mud
description: A ball of mud that has become stiff and hard. Hitting a\nPokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an\nopening for you to act.

name: Pop Pod
description: A sea vegetable used for crafting Scatter Bangs. If you\nwrap it up so that the air has no way to escape, then\ndeal it a sharp blow, it produces a loud popping noise.

name: Sootfoot Root
description: A tuber used for crafting Smoke Bombs. It can be\nmashed for use in cooking, but it can also be dried and\nground to produce a fine powder.

name: Spoiled Apricorn
description: An Apricorn that’s had its insides eaten. Hitting a\nPokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an\nopening for you to act.

name: Snowball
description: A hard ball made of compressed snow. Hitting a\nPokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an\nopening for you to act.

name: Sticky Glob
description: A ball of some kind of sticky substance. Hitting a\nPokémon with one may stun the Pokémon, creating an\nopening for you to act.

name: Black Augurite
description: A glassy black stone that produces a sharp cutting\nedge when split. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Peat Block
description: A block of muddy material that can be used as fuel for\nburning when it is dried. It’s loved by a certain Pokémon.

name: Stealth Spray
description: When used in the field, this spray muffles the sound of\nyour footsteps and makes wild Pokémon less likely to\nnotice you for a short time.

name: Medicinal Leek
description: Required for crafting medicinal compounds. This\nvegetable is found growing across the Hisui region\nand is also known as the wayfarer’s friend.

name: Vivichoke
description: Also called a morning-dew bud. It is used as a material\nfor crafting items that can restore vitality to a Pokémon\nthat has fainted.

name: Pep-Up Plant
description: Extremely spicy but also highly nutritious. This herb is\nused as a material for crafting items that can restore PP\nto Pokémon or boost their stats.

name: Tempting Charm B
description: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any\nother item when you faint in the field. This type of charm\ncomes in five different colors.

name: Tempting Charm P
description: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any\nother item when you faint in the field. This type of charm\ncomes in five different colors.

name: Swordcap
description: Mushrooms that, when consumed, cause the muscles\nto swell. They imbue the eater with strength and are\none of the materials needed for crafting Aux Powers.

name: Iron Barktongue
description: Mushrooms that, when consumed, make the body of\nthe eater grow tougher. They boost endurance and are\none of the materials needed for crafting Aux Guards.

name: Doppel Bonnets
description: Mushrooms that, when consumed, make the eater feel\nnimble and agile as a fleeting shadow. They are one\nof the materials needed for crafting Aux Evasions.

name: Direshroom
description: Mushrooms that, when consumed, sharpen the eater’s\nfocus. They make it easier to land critical hits and are\none of the materials needed for crafting Dire Hits.

name: Sand Radish
description: This bitter root, originally native to sandy beaches, can\nnow be raised even in frozen soil. It is pickled to make a\nsweet and spicy treat known as Twice-Spiced Radishes.

name: Tempting Charm T
description: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any\nother item when you faint in the field. This type of charm\ncomes in five different colors.

name: Tempting Charm Y
description: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any\nother item when you faint in the field. This type of charm\ncomes in five different colors.

name: Candy Truffle
description: A sweet-fleshed truffle that is packed full of mysterious\nenergy. It is one of the materials needed for crafting\nvarious items.

name: Cake-Lure Base
description: A type of field provision that enhances the flavor of\nother foods it is mixed with.

name: Poké Ball
description: A mysterious ball that can be thrown at wild Pokémon\nin order to catch them. These balls can be crafted by\nhand if you gather the necessary materials.

name: Great Ball
description: A mysterious ball that provides a higher success rate\nfor catching Pokémon than a standard Poké Ball.

name: Ultra Ball
description: A mysterious ball that provides an even higher success\nrate for catching Pokémon than a Great Ball does.

name: Feather Ball
description: A ball that flies fast and true—ideal for catching nimble\nPokémon or Pokémon that fly high in the air.

name: Scatter Bang
description: When thrown at the ground, these balls produce a loud\nnoise and scare off weak Pokémon in the area, sending\nthem running.

name: Smoke Bomb
description: When thrown at the ground, these balls produce a cloud\nof fine powder that will reduce visibility in the area and\nkeep wild Pokémon from noticing you.

name: Pokéshi Doll
description: A wooden toy carved in the image of a Pokémon. It can\nbe sold to the general store.

name: Volcano Balm
description: A mysterious balm that gives off a soothing scent.\nIt can be used to help calm the frenzy of the Lord of\nthe Isles, Arcanine.

name: Mountain Balm
description: A mysterious balm that gives off a soothing scent.\nIt can be used to help calm the frenzy of the Lord of\nthe Hollow, Electrode.

name: Snow Balm
description: A mysterious balm that gives off a soothing scent.\nIt can be used to help calm the frenzy of the Lord of\nthe Tundra, Avalugg.

name: Honey Cake
description: A cake made by combining honey with a Cake-Lure\nBase. These cakes are potently effective at attracting\nbug Pokémon and also those with fairylike charms.

name: Grain Cake
description: A cake made by combining grains with a Cake-Lure Base.\nThese cakes are potently effective at attracting Pokémon\nthat dwell and wander among the fields.

name: Bean Cake
description: A cake made by combining beans with a Cake-Lure\nBase. These cakes are potently effective at attracting fish\nPokémon, as well as bird Pokémon and their flying ilk.

name: Mushroom Cake
description: A cake made by combining mushrooms with a Cake-Lure\nBase. These cakes are potently effective at attracting the\nmore monstrous Pokémon, as well as dragon Pokémon.

name: Salt Cake
description: A cake made by combining salt with a Cake-Lure Base.\nThese cakes are potently effective at attracting Pokémon\nthat bear a resemblance to grass, plants, or minerals.

name: Swap Snack
description: A recipe for crafting Swap Snacks from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Candy Truffle, 1 Sootfoot Root,\n1 Springy Mushroom, and 1 Hopo Berry.

name: Choice Dumpling
description: A recipe for crafting Choice Dumplings from scratch.\nRequired materials: 3 Caster Fern leaves, 1 Direshroom,\n1 bunch of Swordcap, and 2 stalks of Hearty Grains.

name: Twice-Spiced Radish
description: A recipe for crafting Twice-Spiced Radishes from scratch.\nRequired materials: 2 Sand Radishes, 2 hunks of Crunchy\nSalt, 2 pods of Plump Beans, and 2 bunches of King’s Leaf.

name: Survival Charm R
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from fainting while out in the field. This type\nof charm comes in five different colors.

name: Survival Charm B
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from fainting while out in the field. This type\nof charm comes in five different colors.

name: Survival Charm P
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from fainting while out in the field. This type\nof charm comes in five different colors.

name: Survival Charm T
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from fainting while out in the field. This type\nof charm comes in five different colors.

name: Survival Charm Y
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from fainting while out in the field. This type\nof charm comes in five different colors.

name: Torn Journal
description: An old, stab-bound diary in a traditional style. It has\nbeen torn and is missing the latter half of its pages.

name: Warding Charm R
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from being afflicted with status conditions.\nThis type of charm comes in five different colors.

name: Warding Charm B
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from being afflicted with status conditions.\nThis type of charm comes in five different colors.

name: Warding Charm P
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from being afflicted with status conditions.\nThis type of charm comes in five different colors.

name: Warding Charm T
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from being afflicted with status conditions.\nThis type of charm comes in five different colors.

name: Warding Charm Y
description: A mysterious charm that holds the power to protect\na person from being afflicted with status conditions.\nThis type of charm comes in five different colors.

name: Wall Fragment
description: A fragment that was once part of a stone panel in the\nSolaceon Ruins. It has markings carved on it that appear\nto be some kind of writing.

name: Basculegion Food
description: A favored food of Basculegion, a Pokémon that will bear\nyou on its back. This food is crafted in an unusual way,\nfrom ingredients gathered via equally unusual methods.

name: Old Journal
description: A stab-bound journal that once had pages torn from it.\nAll the pages have been collected and restored.

name: Wing Ball
description: An improvement on the original Feather Ball design. A\nball that flies fast and true—ideal for catching nimble\nPokémon or Pokémon that fly high in the air.

name: Jet Ball
description: The ultimate iteration of the Feather Ball. A ball that\nflies fast and true—ideal for catching nimble Pokémon\nor Pokémon that fly high in the air.

name: Heavy Ball
description: A ball that is too heavy to fly high or far, but it is highly\neffective if you manage to hit an unsuspecting Pokémon.

name: Leaden Ball
description: An improvement on the original Heavy Ball design.\nA ball that is too heavy to fly high or far, but it is highly\neffective if you manage to hit an unsuspecting Pokémon.

name: Gigaton Ball
description: The ultimate iteration of the Heavy Ball. A ball that is\ntoo heavy to fly high or far, but it is highly effective if\nyou manage to hit an unsuspecting Pokémon.

name: Wing Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Wing Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn, 1 Sky Tumblestone,\nand 1 Iron Chunk.

name: Jet Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Jet Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn, 2 Sky Tumblestones,\nand 2 Iron Chunks.

name: Heavy Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Heavy Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn and 1 Black Tumblestone.

name: Hopo Berry
description: A Berry that can be fed to a Pokémon to restore its PP.\nIf a wild Pokémon eats one of these Berries, that\nPokémon’s reactions will be dulled.

name: Superb Remedy
description: An herbal medicine that can restore 150 HP to a\nPokémon, just as a Hyper Potion does. Yet the bitter\ntaste will make the Pokémon less friendly toward you.

name: Aux Power
description: An item that sharply boosts the offensive stats of a\nPokémon during a battle. These effects disappear if\nthe Pokémon leaves the battle.

name: Aux Guard
description: An item that sharply boosts the defensive stats of a\nPokémon during a battle. These effects disappear if\nthe Pokémon leaves the battle.

name: Aux Evasion
description: An item that makes moves less likely to strike a\nPokémon during a battle. This effect disappears\nif the Pokémon leaves the battle.

name: Grit Dust
description: Mysterious dust that can raise the effort level for one of\na Pokémon’s stats. It can be used to raise effort levels\nonly up to level three, however.

name: Grit Gravel
description: Mysterious gravel that can raise the effort level for one\nof a Pokémon’s stats. It can be used only if the effort\nlevel is at least level three and no greater than level five.

name: Grit Pebble
description: A mysterious pebble that can raise the effort level for\none of a Pokémon’s stats. It can be used only if the effort\nlevel is at least level six and no greater than level eight.

name: Grit Rock
description: A mysterious rock that can raise the effort level for one\nof a Pokémon’s stats. It can be used only if the effort\nlevel has already reached level nine.

name: Secret Medicine
description: An astonishing medicine that can instantly restore health\nto any Pokémon. It is produced by an apothecary in\nCianwood City.

name: Tempting Charm R
description: A mysterious charm that tends to be lost before any\nother item when you faint in the field. This type of charm\ncomes in five different colors.

name: Lost Satchel
description: A satchel that someone dropped.

name: Lost Satchel
description: A satchel that someone dropped.

name: Lost Satchel
description: A satchel that someone dropped.

name: Lost Satchel
description: A satchel that someone dropped.

name: Lost Satchel
description: A satchel that someone dropped.

name: Origin Ball
description: A singular and irreplicable Poké Ball that can be used\nto catch the frenzied Pokémon raging at the Temple\nof Sinnoh.

name: Origin Ore
description: An ore of mysterious power, spoken of in ancient myths\nand said to contain the power of almighty Sinnoh itself.

name: Adamant Crystal
description: When used on Dialga, this large, glowing gem wells\nwith power and allows the Pokémon to change form.

name: Lustrous Globe
description: When used on Palkia, this large, glowing orb wells\nwith power and allows the Pokémon to change form.

name: Griseous Core
description: When used on Giratina, this large, glowing gem wells\nwith power and allows the Pokémon to change form.

name: Blank Plate
description: A stone tablet imbued with the essence of normalcy.\nWhen used on a certain Pokémon, it allows that\nPokémon to gain the power of the Normal type.

name: Crafting Kit
description: A kit containing everything you might need for crafting,\neven when there is no workbench around. However, you\ncan only use the materials you have in your satchel.

name: Leaden Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Leaden Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn, 1 Black Tumblestone,\nand 1 Iron Chunk.

name: Gigaton Ball
description: A recipe for crafting Gigaton Balls from scratch.\nRequired materials: 1 Apricorn, 2 Black Tumblestones,\nand 2 Iron Chunks.

name: Strange Ball
description: ー\nー\nー

name: Pokédex
description: A volume for compiling the collected results of much\nPokémon research. Professor Laventon continually adds\nto it with each report made on new Pokémon species.

name: Old Verse 1
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 2
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 3
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 15
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 16
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 17
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 18
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 19
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Old Verse 20
description: Part of a series of old poems that have been unearthed\naround the Hisui region. Judging from the handwriting,\nit appears they were all written by the same person.

name: Legend Plate
description: A stone tablet imbued with the essence of all creation.\nWhen used on a certain Pokémon, it allows that\nPokémon to gain the power of every type there is.

name: Master Ball
description: Assurément la Poké Ball la plus performante.\nElle permet de capturer à coup sûr un Pokémon\nsauvage.

name: Hyper Ball
description: Une Poké Ball très performante dont le taux de réussite\nest supérieur à celui de la Super Ball.

name: Super Ball
description: Une Poké Ball très performante dont le taux de réussite\nest supérieur à celui de la Poké Ball.

name: Poké Ball
description: Un objet semblable à une capsule, qui capture\nles Pokémon sauvages. Il suffit pour cela de\nle lancer comme une balle.

name: Safari Ball
description: Une Poké Ball spéciale dont l’usage est réservé au\nGrand Marais. Elle est décorée d’un motif camouflage.

name: Filet Ball
description: Une Poké Ball un peu spéciale qui fonctionne\nparticulièrement bien sur les Pokémon Eau ou Insecte.

name: Scuba Ball
description: Une Poké Ball un peu spéciale qui fonctionne\nparticulièrement bien sur les Pokémon sous-marins.

name: Faiblo Ball
description: Une Poké Ball un peu spéciale qui fonctionne\nparticulièrement bien sur les Pokémon les plus faibles.

name: Bis Ball
description: Une Poké Ball un peu spéciale qui fonctionne\nparticulièrement bien sur les espèces de Pokémon\ndéjà capturées.

name: Chrono Ball
description: Une Poké Ball un peu spéciale qui fonctionne\nde mieux en mieux à mesure que le combat s’éternise.

name: Luxe Ball
description: Une Poké Ball pratique qui permet de gagner\nrapidement l’amitié d’un Pokémon sauvage attrapé.

name: Honor Ball
description: Une Poké Ball assez rare qui fut créée\npour un évènement particulier.

name: Sombre Ball
description: Une Poké Ball efficace de nuit ou dans les endroits\nsombres, tels que les grottes.

name: Soin Ball
description: Une Poké Ball de soin qui rend tous ses PV au Pokémon\nattrapé et qui soigne toutes ses altérations de statut.

name: Rapide Ball
description: Une Poké Ball qui permet d’attraper un Pokémon\nsauvage plus facilement si on l’utilise au début\ndu combat.

name: Mémoire Ball
description: Une Poké Ball plutôt rare qui fut créée\npour une occasion spéciale.

name: Potion
description: Une pommade qui soigne les blessures.\nRestaure 60 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Antidote
description: Un médicament sous forme de spray.\nGuérit un Pokémon empoisonné.

name: Anti-Brûle
description: Un médicament sous forme de spray.\nSoigne les brûlures d’un Pokémon.

name: Antigel
description: Un médicament sous forme de spray.\nRéchauffe un Pokémon gelé.

name: Réveil
description: Un médicament sous forme de spray.\nRéveille un Pokémon endormi.

name: Anti-Para
description: Un médicament sous forme de spray.\nSoigne un Pokémon de la paralysie.

name: Guérison
description: Une pommade qui restaure tous les PV d’un Pokémon\net soigne toutes ses altérations de statut.

name: Potion Max
description: Une pommade qui soigne les blessures.\nRestaure tous les PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Hyper Potion
description: Une pommade qui soigne les blessures.\nRestaure 150 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Super Potion
description: Une pommade qui soigne les blessures.\nRestaure 100 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Total Soin
description: Une pommade qui soigne toutes les altérations\nde statut d’un Pokémon.

name: Rappel
description: Un médicament qui ranime un Pokémon K.O.\net restaure la moitié de ses PV max.

name: Rappel Max
description: Un médicament qui ranime un Pokémon K.O.\net restaure tous ses PV.

name: Eau Fraîche
description: Une eau riche en minéraux.\nRestaure 30 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Soda Cool
description: Une boisson pétillante.\nRestaure 50 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Limonade
description: Une boisson très sucrée.\nRestaure 70 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Lait Meumeu
description: Un lait très nourrissant.\nRestaure 100 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Poudrénergie
description: Une poudre médicinale très amère.\nRestaure 60 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Racinénergie
description: Une racine très amère.\nRestaure 120 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Poudre Soin
description: Une poudre médicinale très amère.\nSoigne toutes les altérations de statut d’un Pokémon.

name: Herbe Rappel
description: Une herbe médicinale très amère.\nRanime un Pokémon K.O. et restaure tous ses PV.

name: Huile
description: Restaure 10 PP d’une capacité sélectionnée.

name: Soin PP
description: Restaure tous les PP d’une capacité sélectionnée.

name: Élixir
description: Restaure 10 PP de toutes les capacités d’un Pokémon.

name: Maxi Soin PP
description: Restaure tous les PP de toutes les capacités\nd’un Pokémon.

name: Lava Cookie
description: Une spécialité de Vermilava.\nSoigne toutes les altérations de statut d’un Pokémon.

name: Jus de Baie
description: Une boisson 100 % pur Jus de Baie.\nRestaure 20 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Cendre Sacrée
description: Ranime tous les Pokémon K.O. et restaure tous leurs PV.

name: PV Plus
description: Une boisson très nutritive qui augmente\nles PV de base d’un Pokémon.

name: Protéine
description: Une boisson très nutritive qui augmente\nl’Attaque de base d’un Pokémon.

name: Fer
description: Une boisson très nutritive qui augmente\nla Défense de base d’un Pokémon.

name: Carbone
description: Une boisson très nutritive qui augmente\nla Vitesse de base d’un Pokémon.

name: Calcium
description: Une boisson très nutritive qui augmente\nl’Attaque Spéciale de base d’un Pokémon.

name: Super Bonbon
description: Un bonbon plein d’énergie.\nIl permet à un Pokémon de monter d’un niveau.

name: PP Plus
description: Augmente un peu les PP max d’une capacité\nsélectionnée.

name: Zinc
description: Une boisson très nutritive qui augmente\nla Défense Spéciale de base d’un Pokémon.

name: PP Max
description: Augmente sensiblement les PP max d’une capacité\nsélectionnée.

name: Vieux Gâteau
description: Un mets typique de Rusti-Cité que seuls les fins\ngourmets savent où trouver. Il soigne toutes\nles altérations de statut d’un Pokémon.

name: Garde-Stats
description: Empêche la baisse des stats de tous les Pokémon\nde l’équipe pendant cinq tours.

name: Muscle +
description: Augmente fortement le taux de critiques.\nUtilisable une seule fois.\nL’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Attaque +
description: Augmente beaucoup l’Attaque pendant un combat.\nL’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Défense +
description: Augmente beaucoup la Défense pendant un combat.\nL’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Vitesse +
description: Augmente beaucoup la Vitesse pendant un combat.\nL’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Précision +
description: Augmente beaucoup la Précision pendant un combat.\nL’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Atq. Spé. +
description: Augmente beaucoup l’Attaque Spéciale pendant\nun combat. L’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Déf. Spé. +
description: Augmente beaucoup la Défense Spéciale pendant\nun combat. L’effet disparaît si le Pokémon est retiré.

name: Poké Poupée
description: Une poupée qui attire les Pokémon.\nPermet de s’enfuir d’un combat contre\nun Pokémon sauvage.

name: Queue Skitty
description: Un objet qui attire les Pokémon.\nPermet de s’enfuir d’un combat contre\nun Pokémon sauvage.

name: Flûte Bleue
description: Un jouet en forme de flûte en verre bleu.\nRéveille un Pokémon endormi.

name: Flûte Jaune
description: Un jouet en forme de flûte en verre jaune.\nSoigne la confusion.

name: Flûte Rouge
description: Un jouet en forme de flûte en verre rouge.\nAnnule l’effet du statut attraction.

name: Flûte Noire
description: Un jouet en forme de flûte en verre noir.\nAugmente les chances de rencontrer des Pokémon\nsauvages puissants là où l’on en joue.

name: Flûte Blanche
description: Un jouet en forme de flûte en verre blanc.\nAugmente les chances de rencontrer des Pokémon\nsauvages faibles là où l’on en joue.

name: Sel Tréfonds
description: Du sel provenant de la Grotte Tréfonds.

name: CoquilleTréfonds
description: Un coquillage provenant de la Grotte Tréfonds.

name: Tesson Rouge
description: Un petit tesson rouge.\nIl semble provenir d’un objet très ancien.

name: Tesson Bleu
description: Un petit tesson bleu.\nIl semble provenir d’un objet très ancien.

name: Tesson Jaune
description: Un petit tesson jaune.\nIl semble provenir d’un objet très ancien.

name: Tesson Vert
description: Un petit tesson vert.\nIl semble provenir d’un objet très ancien.

name: Super Repousse
description: Repousse les Pokémon sauvages faibles pendant\nune durée plus longue que celle du Repousse.

name: Repousse Max
description: Repousse les Pokémon sauvages faibles pendant\nune durée plus longue que celle du Super Repousse.

name: Corde Sortie
description: Une corde longue et solide permettant de sortir\nrapidement d’une grotte ou d’un donjon.\nElle peut être utilisée à volonté.

name: Repousse
description: Repousse les Pokémon sauvages faibles pendant\nun court moment.

name: Pierre Soleil
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle est rouge comme le soleil couchant.

name: Pierre Lune
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle est sombre comme la nuit.

name: Pierre Feu
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle est jaune et orange.

name: Pierre Foudre
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Un éclair est dessiné dessus.

name: Pierre Eau
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle est de couleur bleue.

name: Pierre Plante
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Une feuille est dessinée dessus.

name: Petit Champi
description: Un petit champignon assez rare.\nIl est plutôt populaire parmi certains fans dévoués.

name: Gros Champi
description: Un grand champignon assez rare.\nIl est très populaire parmi certains fans dévoués.

name: Perle
description: Une petite perle qui brille d’une jolie couleur argent.\nPeut être vendue à bas prix en magasin.

name: Grande Perle
description: Une grosse perle qui brille d’une jolie couleur argent.\nPeut être vendue à bon prix en magasin.

name: Poussière Étoile
description: Du sable rouge ravissant, aux grains très fins.\nPeut être vendu à la Boutique pour un peu d’argent.

name: Morceau d’Étoile
description: Un fragment de gemme qui brille d’un éclat rouge.\nPeut être vendu à bon prix à la Boutique.

name: Pépite
description: Une pépite d’or pur qui brille d’un éclat magnifique.\nPeut être vendue à bon prix à la Boutique.

name: Écaille Cœur
description: Une écaille très rare et jolie en forme de cœur.\nCertaines personnes sont ravies quand on leur\nen donne une.

name: Miel
description: Du miel au parfum riche rassemblé par des Pokémon.\nPeut être vendu à bas prix en magasin.

name: Fertipousse
description: Un engrais à utiliser sur un sol meuble.\nIl n’est cependant pas adapté aux terres de Hoenn\net n’y a aucun effet.

name: Fertihumide
description: Un engrais à utiliser sur un sol meuble.\nIl n’est cependant pas adapté aux terres de Hoenn\net n’y a aucun effet.

name: Fertistable
description: Un engrais à utiliser sur un sol meuble.\nIl n’est cependant pas adapté aux terres de Hoenn\net n’y a aucun effet.

name: Fertiglu
description: Un engrais à utiliser sur un sol meuble.\nIl n’est cependant pas adapté aux terres de Hoenn\net n’y a aucun effet.

name: Fossile Racine
description: Le fossile d’un ancien Pokémon aquatique.\nOn dirait un morceau de racine.

name: Fossile Griffe
description: Le fossile d’un ancien Pokémon aquatique.\nOn dirait un morceau de griffe.

name: Nautile
description: Le fossile d’un ancien Pokémon aquatique.\nOn dirait un morceau de coquillage.

name: Fossile Dôme
description: Le fossile d’un ancien Pokémon aquatique.\nOn dirait un morceau de carapace.

name: Vieil Ambre
description: Un morceau d’ambre contenant l’ADN d’un ancien\nPokémon. Il est de couleur jaune.

name: Fossile Armure
description: Le fossile d’un Pokémon préhistorique terrestre.\nOn dirait un morceau de collerette osseuse.

name: Fossile Crâne
description: Le fossile d’un Pokémon préhistorique terrestre.\nOn dirait un morceau de crâne.

name: Os Rare
description: Un os d’une grande valeur pour l’archéologie Pokémon.\nPeut être vendu à bon prix en magasin.

name: Pierre Éclat
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle brille d’une lumière aveuglante.

name: Pierre Nuit
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle est sombre comme une nuit sans lune.

name: Pierre Aube
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle brille comme un œil.

name: Pierre Ovale
description: Une pierre étrange qui fait évoluer certaines espèces\nde Pokémon. Elle a la forme d’un œuf.

name: Clé de Voûte
description: Une pierre mystérieuse qui permet de rassembler\ndes Flammes Étranges de couleur violette.

name: Orbe Platiné
description: Un mystérieux objet destiné à Giratina.\nAméliore les capacités de types Dragon et Spectre.

name: Thé
description: Un thé aromatique légèrement amer.\nIl a des vertus désaltérantes.

name: Dédicace de Bob
description: C’est un autographe de Major Bob, le Champion\nde l’Arène de Carmin sur Mer ! Il y a écrit « Good\nluck ! » dessus.

name: Module Aqua
description: Tenu par Genesect, ce module change la capacité\nTechno-Buster en une capacité de type Eau.

name: Module Choc
description: Tenu par Genesect, ce module change la capacité\nTechno-Buster en une capacité de type Électrik.

name: Module Pyro
description: Tenu par Genesect, ce module change la capacité\nTechno-Buster en une capacité de type Feu.

name: Module Cryo
description: Tenu par Genesect, ce module change la capacité\nTechno-Buster en une capacité de type Glace.

name: Malle à Costumes
description: Une malle très légère qui contient vos costumes\net ceux de votre partenaire.

name: Chococœur
description: Un chocolat extrêmement sucré.\nRestaure 20 PV d’un Pokémon.

name: Orbe Adamant
description: Un orbe très brillant destiné à Dialga.\nAugmente la puissance des capacités de types\nDragon et Acier.

name: Orbe Perlé
description: Un bel orbe luisant destiné à Palkia.\nAugmente la puissance des capacités de types\nDragon et Eau.

name: Lettre Salut
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour se présenter.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Fan
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour parler de ce que\nl’on aime. Peut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Invit
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour les invitations.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Merci
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour les remerciements.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Demande
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour poser des questions.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Avis
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour donner des conseils.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Réponse
description: Un papier à lettres idéal pour répondre à un autre\ncourrier. Peut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Pont S
description: Un papier à lettres avec un motif de pont traversant\nle ciel. Peut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Pont Y
description: Un papier à lettres avec un motif de pont mobile rouge.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Pont F
description: Un papier à lettres avec un motif de pont suspendu\nen acier. Peut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Pont H
description: Un papier à lettres avec un motif de pont en briques.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Lettre Pont I
description: Un papier à lettres avec un motif de pont à voûtes.\nPeut être tenu et livré par un Pokémon.

name: Baie Ceriz
description: Une Baie qui soigne la paralysie lorsqu’elle est\nmangée par un Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité\nd’un Pokémon, cela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Maron
description: Une Baie qui soigne la somnolence lorsqu’elle est\nmangée par un Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité\nd’un Pokémon, cela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Pêcha
description: Une Baie qui soigne l’empoisonnement lorsqu’elle est\nmangée par un Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité\nd’un Pokémon, cela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Fraive
description: Une Baie qui soigne une brûlure lorsqu’elle est\nmangée par un Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité\nd’un Pokémon, cela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Willia
description: Une Baie qui soigne la gelure lorsqu’elle est mangée par\nun Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité d’un Pokémon,\ncela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Mepo
description: Une Baie qui restaure 10 PP lorsqu’elle est mangée par\nun Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité d’un Pokémon,\ncela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Oran
description: Une Baie qui restaure 20 PV lorsqu’elle est mangée par\nun Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité d’un Pokémon,\ncela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Kika
description: Une Baie qui soigne la confusion lorsqu’elle est tenue\npar un Pokémon.

name: Baie Prine
description: Une Baie qui soigne toutes les altérations de statut\nlorsqu’elle est mangée par un Pokémon. Si on la lance\nà proximité d’un Pokémon, cela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Sitrus
description: Une Baie qui restaure la moitié des PV max lorsqu’elle\nest mangée par un Pokémon. Si on la lance à proximité\nd’un Pokémon, cela attirera son attention.

name: Baie Figuy
description: Une Baie qui restaure jusqu’à la moitié des PV max du\nPokémon qui la mange. Elle immobilisera momentanément\nun Pokémon sauvage qui n’aime pas les aliments épicés.

name: Baie Wiki
description: Une Baie qui restaure jusqu’à la moitié des PV max du\nPokémon qui la mange. Elle immobilisera momentanément\nun Pokémon sauvage qui n’aime pas les aliments âpres.

name: Baie Mago
description: Une Baie qui restaure jusqu’à la moitié des PV max du\nPokémon qui la mange. Elle immobilisera momentanément\nun Pokémon sauvage qui n’aime pas les aliments sucrés.

name: Baie Gowav
description: Une Baie qui restaure jusqu’à la moitié des PV max du\nPokémon qui la mange. Elle immobilisera momentanément\nun Pokémon sauvage qui n’aime pas les aliments amers.

name: Baie Papaya
description: Une Baie qui restaure jusqu’à la moitié des PV max du\nPokémon qui la mange. Elle immobilisera momentanément\nun Pokémon sauvage qui n’aime pas les aliments acides.

name: Baie Framby
description: Une Baie qui restaure un tiers des PV max lorsqu’elle est\nmangée par un Pokémon. En outre, elle facilite la capture\ndes spécimens sauvages.

name: Baie Remu
description: Une Baie violette et âpre, utilisée pour préparer\ndes Pokéblocs permettant d’augmenter la Beauté\nd’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Nanab
description: Une Baie qui restaure un tiers des PV max lorsqu’elle est\nmangée par un Pokémon. Si c’est un Pokémon sauvage\nqui la mange, ses mouvements deviennent plus lents.

name: Baie Repoi
description: Une Baie verte au goût amer, utilisée pour préparer\ndes Pokéblocs permettant d’augmenter l’Intelligence\nd’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Nanana
description: Une Baie qui restaure un tiers des PV max du Pokémon\nqui la mange. Si c’est un Pokémon sauvage qui la mange,\nvous recevrez plus de Points d’Expérience en l’attrapant.

name: Baie Grena
description: Une Baie qui rend les Pokémon plus amicaux,\nmais baisse leurs PV de base.

name: Baie Alga
description: Une Baie qui rend les Pokémon plus amicaux,\nmais baisse leur Attaque de base.

name: Baie Qualot
description: Une Baie qui rend les Pokémon plus amicaux,\nmais baisse leur Défense de base.

name: Baie Lonme
description: Une Baie qui rend les Pokémon plus amicaux,\nmais baisse leur Attaque Spéciale de base.

name: Baie Résin
description: Une Baie qui rend les Pokémon plus amicaux,\nmais baisse leur Défense Spéciale de base.

name: Baie Tamato
description: Une Baie qui rend les Pokémon plus amicaux,\nmais baisse leur Vitesse de base.

name: Baie Siam
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter la Beauté d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Mangou
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter la Grâce d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Rabuta
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter l’Intelligence d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Tronci
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter la Robustesse d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Kiwan
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter la Grâce d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Palma
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter la Beauté d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Stekpa
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter l’Intelligence d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Durin
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter l’Intelligence d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Myrte
description: Une Baie très rare en dehors de cette région,\nutilisée pour préparer des Pokéblocs permettant\nd’augmenter la Beauté d’un Pokémon.

name: Baie Chocco
